Class MemorySpace

java.lang.Object
microsim.simulation.component.SimulationComponent
microsim.simulation.component.MemorySpace
public class MemorySpace extends SimulationComponent
Implements a memory space as a (to outside users) contiguous array of byte locations. Memory is divided in three regions:
  1. RAM, Random Access Memory for general access. Spans from 0x0000 to 0x7fff (32 KiB).
  2. VRAM, Video Random Access Memory that gets rendered to video on VideoDevice.render() calls. Spans from 0x8000 to 0x93ff (5 KiB).
  3. EPROM, Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory that contains program code and data at startup. Spans from 0x9400 to 0xffff (27 KiB).

  • Constructor Details

    • MemorySpace

      public MemorySpace(Bus bus, byte[] epromData)
      Instantiates memory space, taking a reference to the bus it's mounted on and the EPROM data it should load in the EPROM region.
      Parameters:
      bus - bus the component is mounted on
      epromData - EPROM data to load in eprom

  • Method Details

    • step

      public void step()
      Steps by handling read/write operations seen on bus. Bus protocol is the following:
      • If Bus.targetSpace is not low, ignore any operation.
      • If Bus.readEnable is high, start a read operation:
        1. Read address from Bus.addressLine.
        2. Read data at address.
        3. Drive Bus.dataLine for 1 simulation step.
      • If Bus.writeEnable is high, start a write operation:
        1. Read address from Bus.addressLine and data from Bus.dataLine.
        2. Write data at address.
      If both Bus.readEnable and Bus.writeEnable are high, raises an exception.
      Specified by:
      step in class SimulationComponent

    • readMemory

      public byte readMemory(char addr)
      Reads from memory space at a given address. This is not meant to be used by other simulation components, but by DebugShell objects displaying shells.
      Parameters:
      addr - address to read from
      Returns:
      data read

    • writeMemory

      public void writeMemory(char addr, byte data)
      Writes to memory space at a given address. Usage is same as readMemory(char).
      Parameters:
      addr - address to write to
      data - data to write

    • getVRAM

      public byte[] getVRAM()
      Returns VRAM byte array. Used by VideoDevice for direct VRAM accesses when rendering to frame buffer.
      Returns:
      VRAM byte array
